1.Pros: I loved all the food you can eat and the flexible hours.

2.Pros: i dont know i guess you get experience in fast paced enviroment.

3.Pros: Learn a ton of skills. Learn how to work under pressure and in a fast paced environment. Chances to move up in the company. Meet tons of people. Sometimes develop friendships.
3.Cons: Legitimately the only pro to being a certified swing manager is a small raise, and you get whatever you want for an employee meal. No vacation time. Really no benefits at all. Training new crew is such a struggle because sometimes you get stuck with multiple new people and no crew trainers to help you. People consistently call in so you're almost always shorthanded, so be prepared to get yelled at by customers. Oh and big time favoritism between certain managers and crew.

5.Pros: Good and friendly co-workers. Professional shift managers.
5.Cons: No cons I can think of.

6.Pros: FlexibilityFun environmentOpportunity for advancementThere is always room for growth and they have programs that will help you get your GED. Ongoing training programs

7.Pros: Great customer service skills with the customers.
7.Cons: Management is very poor and lack involvement.

8.Pros: Free lunch for working over 3 hours.
8.Cons: little hours and no room for promotion.

9.Summary: "When I call they are rude. I'm a General Manager at another location. It's not what you say is how you say it."
9.Pros: The benefit and the pay and the customer that come in everyday. To spend money and to have QSC&V in place. All smile on deck and neat uniforms.
